intro: Baeria californica, commonly known as the California baeria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a bluish-green color. It produces small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale pink, typically blooming in spring. Baeria californica is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems.
